intro: Leptotes serrulata, commonly known as the serrated lespedeza, is a flowering plant native to eastern North America. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and small, pink to reddish-purple flowers. The plant typically grows in open woodlands and disturbed soils, thriving in full sun to partial shade. Its seeds are enclosed in pods and are an important food source for various wildlife species.
